result.execSummary:
The defendant Raul Ponce Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges, and assessments. Cash bail to apply. Balance to be returned to poster. Pay all supervision fees. Defendant to make regular monthly payments.
Seek and maintain full time employment.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearm/body armor.

No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No driving without a valid drivers license.

Continue drug treatment. Agent may request an assessment.
Maintain absolute sobriety, no alochol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers. Defendant shall be tested twice per month for the first year, and then be tested once per month, randomly.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raul Ponce Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 06/16/14. AR

Defendant Raul Ponce in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Stephan Nolten.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 120 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 28 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, treatment, and meeting with agent.

REPORT IN DATE:  June 6, 2014 at 5 pm.
If defendant fails to report, defendant shall serve sentence STRAIGHT TIME, WITH NO RELEASE PRIVILEGES.

- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments.  Cash bail to apply.  Balance to be returned to poster.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Court sentenced defendant to serve 1 YEAR in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence.  COURT ORDERED TO BE SERVED STRAIGHT TIME, NO RELEASE PRIVILEDGES.  Court gives credit for 0 days served. 

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS with the following conditions:

- 90 DAYS, IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations.  Defendant shall serve 10 days for the first violation, 20 days for the second violation, and 60 days for the third violation.
- Continue drug treatment.  Agent may request an assessment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.  Defendant shall be tested twice per month for the first year, and then be tested once per month, randomly.  
- Seek and maintain full time employment.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- No driving without a valid drivers license.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments.  Cash bail to apply.  Balance to be returned to poster.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Raul Ponce in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 3.
As to both counts:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Case is adjourned to 6-3-2014 at 1:30pm Branch 3 for sentencing.

Defendant Raul Ponce in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case rescheduled due to the lateness of the hour.  Case ajdourned for plea and sentencing at 4/8/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

14RM003681  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
1/28/14 vf

Attorney Richard J Carpenter in court, defendant Raul Ponce not in court, in custody.  Stephan E. Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea on 3/13/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea hearing scheduled for March 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court closed on 1-28-2014 due to severe weather.  Case adjourned to Branch 3 on 1-29-2014 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Raul Ponce in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Raul Ponce in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki for Stephan E. Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Raul Ponce in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Raul Ponce in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
